comments:
Problem: a model referencing platform:/plugin/org.eclipse.emf.ecore/model/Ecore.ecore was developed in Project1/models/xxx.ecore then moved to Project2/yyy.ecore. Using the Sample Ecore Model Editor on yyy.ecore gives

Problems encountered in file "platform:/../plugin/org.eclipse.emf.ecore/model/Ecore.ecore"
java.net.MalformedURLException: Unsupported "platform:" protocol variation "..".

	at org.eclipse.equinox.internal.app.EclipseAppHandle.run(EclipseAppHandle.java:147)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.internal.adaptor.EclipseAppLauncher.runApplication(EclipseAppLauncher.java:104)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.internal.adaptor.EclipseAppLauncher.start(EclipseAppLauncher.java:74)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:354)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:170)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:585)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.invokeFramework(Main.java:339)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:283)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:984)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:959)

because the copied file contained
eType="ecore:EClass ../../../plugin/org.eclipse.emf.ecore/model/Ecore.ecore#//EEnum"

relocating "platform:" wrt to Project1 and consequently erroneously for Project2.

The error message is very misleading, since the source file did not actually use platform:.

The problem would not occur if the copied file contained eType="ecore:EClass platform:/plugin/org.eclipse.emf.ecore/model/Ecore.ecore#//EEnum"

Relative references will always suffer from this type of problem.  We'd need to hook into the refactoring support to correct the references as files are moved are copied, but we don't have the resource for that work.  Doing a Save As could be used as a workaround for the issue.  Note that the new OPTION_URI_HANDLER could be used to tailor which URIs are made relative and which are left as absolute...

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 149508 ***

Although this is indeed another case that should be addressed by a "Model Refactor" implementation, we think that we can improve things for the Ecore and GenModel files.  It would be too risk to do that for all resources we serialize but definitely, though.

The idea is to change EcoreResourceFactoryImpl to add a URIHandler that would have a special treatment for platform URIs.
The changes are committed to CVS.
